tweets.text:
Welcome to El Dorado, admittedly an atypical name for a #Yorkshire beck! I promise it does contain some gold
(en) wee trout.
We encapsulated ALL of it to protect spawning habitat. Listening to a babbling beck, skylarks, peewits today...Joy!
@WildTroutTrust @EnvAgencyYNE https://t.co/i7AzSMsz1W

Tree maintenance work continues along #Broadgate to protect the current #flood defences in the area. This is being carried out for the Environment Agency and #Preston City Council by local contractors.

Find out more on the scheme: https://t.co/y1EkzOHvp7 https://t.co/7wuUUeiT9o

Becks like El Dorado may be <1m wide but are incredibly important for spawning & nursery habitat where much of the main river is limestone bedrock. Check out the beauty below. Perfection in miniature... 
@WildTroutTrust @EnvAgencyYNE #RiparianTreeFund @DefraGovUK https://t.co/VEUOp0AXg3
@Jack_Hirst3 @WildTroutTrust @EnvAgencyYNE I picture a mass cyclic migration from #Malham to Halton Gill like the wildebeest of the Serengeti... but with stuntier legs 😉

In the #LandscapestoLifescapes exhibition we've brought environmental & social sciences together to explore the causes & consequences of #flooding. Too often these perspectives are falsely separated @TheEPS1 @TheBDMA  @TheFloodHub @EnvAgencyNW #SciComm https://t.co/SZ2uFbrG84

Several vehicles have been seized and more than 20 people are being investigated following an operation to tackle waste crime in Cheshire. Our @CheshPolRural led last week’s operation in collaboration with @EnvAgency, @WarringtonBC, @Go_CheshireWest and @CheshireEast. https://t.co/2ErkwENGlQ

Poor old @EnvAgency the wheels really are coming off the bus.

2019/20 target for "Kms of rivers enhanced", 2,300. 

Achieved? 1,753. Oops.

Target for 20/21 3,900.

Achieved in Q1? 31. Yes, that's right 31. Double oops.

PS. Can anyone tell me what "Enhanced", actually means? https://t.co/oa1m2WCN5V

@Sarah07909750 @cheshirepolice @CheshPolRural @EnvAgency @WarringtonBC @Go_CheshireWest @CheshireEast I didn't know we could do that! So we can just arrange to have stuff picked up if it's too big for the bin etc?

I am aware that the smell from the landfill was particularly bad overnight. Many constituents have complained to @EnvAgency, @NewsNBC, or both.

I have written to the EA and to Red for an explanation.

Report odour to the EA via 0800 80 70 60 or ics@environment-agency.gov.uk https://t.co/DHj0O6B0f5

Today we have published our Regulating for People, the Environment and Growth report.

It shows the importance of regulation in allowing industry to thrive while protecting air, land and water. 

Read the full report here - https://t.co/qDmR5R6ZSy https://t.co/jvZwAb1Vd7
@cheshirepolice @CheshPolRural @EnvAgency @WarringtonBC @Go_CheshireWest @CheshireEast While the majority of us pay the council £40 to pick up & remove any unwanted household items

So apart from the totally meaningless corporate performance target "kms of rivers enhanced", it appears the @EnvAgency have pulled another funny with "reducing pollution incidents". Just make it go away, don't bother reporting it. "Trebles all round." 😂

https://t.co/7r5OGuYYQc

urls.title: Operators 'required' to store clinical waste inside
urls.description: The Environment Agency has insisted that clinical waste must be stored and handled in a building, under new healthcare waste management guidance.

tweets.text: Operators to be ‘required’ to store clinical waste inside https://t.co/KlpJg1dbml via @letsrecycle this obviously doesn’t apply to the cowboys within the industry as stored outside by @SharpsmartUK @whmalcolm @mitie but funny enough the @EnvAgency don’t prosecute @scottishepa

@Melindola @Feargal_Sharkey @JamesBevanEA @EnvAgency Fly tippers have become more resourceful & less people are throwing apple cores out their car windows. EA should have 30 days to reveal whether they have inspected #HappyEgg &/or issued an advisory notice. Looking forward to the FOI from River Action.
#transparency
@GreedSpam @Feargal_Sharkey @JamesBevanEA @EnvAgency And the number of prosecutions has plummeted too, things that cost money avoided.

tweets.text:

urls.title: Cleaning Up with Michael Liebreich / Episode 31 - Emma Howard Boyd
urls.description: Emma Howard Boyd is one of the leading voices the UK’s Environment scene. As the Chair of the Environment Agency, she is at the forefront of the current environment agenda. This week, Michael and Emma will discuss everything from recent flooding in the UK to the unique UWC schooling experience.

tweets.text:
@EmmaHowardBoyd, Chair of the @EnvAgency, is an alumnus from @UWCint along with @BerniceWLee, @GSchmidtTraub, and @colinmckerrache. Listen to her experience at this unique schooling system and how it started her love for the natural environment 🌱

https://t.co/2EFmNbo67J https://t.co/GfepEtyXmI
Why do people think this is acceptable behaviour 🤬🤬FFS https://t.co/7EaLLRLDTU
@ProfJGrey @WildTroutTrust @EnvAgencyYNE Looking good!! Be interesting to see if it becomes suitable for water voles?

Just watched the Sunday night BBC London news story about the Welsh Harp reservoir. The usual inaction from the @EnvAgency - basically they’ve done  sweet FA to protect an SSSI. Thx to @ben_watt and @welshharpies for bringing this to public attention

tweets.text:
Illegal nets and traps endanger wildlife. 

Fishery officers were recently called to this illegal net on a lake in the South East – the fish were returned unharmed.

If you see signs of illegal fishing, call our incident hotline on 0800 807060 so our officers can investigate. https://t.co/joOZdWQAXx

tweets.text:
This lovely Kestrel, perched prominently on a tree top, is just one of wildlife species you can spot in the Welsh Harp. #SSSI 
Captured by @samina_bulgin 
Help us to protect our reservoir! @Natures_Voice @WildLondon @EnvAgency https://t.co/LUIWSWgHw8

It's so sad to see the canal you love polluted by oil and diesel. Watching helplessly as ducks and geese struggle through the slime. It's been like this for five days, worsening, and the cause hasn't been found. #Retweet #PeakForestCanal @BBCNWT @CanalRiverTrust @EnvAgency https://t.co/oKzQsGztFK

tweets.text:
Still no comment from the @EnvAgency 
I'm chasing... https://t.co/wxlbcpP8RE

@Melindola @Feargal_Sharkey @JamesBevanEA @EnvAgency The incompetence is the plummeted 'cautions' an abject failure at the hands of the EA.
Businesses are a collection of individuals but big business is not people (a person)
SSAFO & FRfW regulations are sound, it's the application of enforcement that's at fault.
#HappyEgg

@EarthlyIdeas @BurnhamDeepdale @EnvAgencyAnglia @jamesowild @EnvAgency @NorfolkCoastNT @EDP24 @TheLynnNews @fakenhamtimes Hi Jason, I'm sorry to hear this. Please can you DM me the full address & your best contact number? I will look into this

@74JMH @AndynBrown16 @EnvAgency Hi @74JMH you can report incidents of this nature to our 24 hour incident hotline on 0800 80 70 60. This will then be on our systems and we can investigate further- thank you.

@AnglianWater your sewage system is overflowing again in @BurnhamDeepdale. Weeks & weeks of you flooding sewage into harbour, with no solution in sight. What is answer to endless problem?

@EnvAgencyAnglia @jamesowild @EnvAgency @NorfolkCoastNT @EDP24 @TheLynnNews @fakenhamtimes https://t.co/wq8tannpqY

The @EnvAgency has published the Regulating for People, the Environment and Growth report. 

Regulation is an important tool which we can use to leave the environment in a better state than we found it. 

Read the full report here: https://t.co/Vc0iVG4B5h https://t.co/ti45Wu0Hn4

tweets.text:
Could anyone please advise why DEFRA Sandy monitor which covers #Herts & #Beds network is no longer measuring PM2.5? Data has not been available from this monitor for 47 days so far this year. 
@DefraGovUK @EnvAgency @CleanAirLondon https://t.co/4mLJKWrZ9C
@ARFlather @EnvAgency Back in the halcyon days of lockdown one we witnessed someone push this fridge into the canal in broad daylight. Crazy. https://t.co/CCqXXv2lFE

Thank you Essex County Council the culvert in #siblehedingham between Brook Meadow and Bloor Homes is being inspected with a camera this morning.
